column1: PhD and Postdoc Positions In Materials-directed Synthetic Biology.;"The Department of Synthetic Biology at the University of Freiburg (Research Group Prof. Wilfried Weber) is offering
PhD and Postdoc Positions
In Materials-directed Synthetic Biology.
By using versatile synthetic biology techniques including latest optogenetic approaches
column2: you will develop cell biological and biochemical strategies to synthesize adaptive and interactive materials for different applications including biomedicine
column3: construction

column1: A special focus will be on optogenetic methods to structure material properties in four dimensions by using spatiotemporally controlled illumination as structuring principle.
In this position you will have the opportunity to acquire broad knowledge and experience in two rapidly emerging fields with a strong application potential
column2: engineered living materials as well as molecular optogenetics. You will profit from the broad expertise of one of the leading labs in molecular optogenetics (https://www.optobase.org/fte/?q=*).

column1: You will work in an international
column2: interdisciplinary team using state-of-the-art research facilities. From previous lab members we have seen that experience in the above-mentioned field is a perfect starting point for pursuing an industrial or academic career afterwards.

column1: We are looking for PhD and Postdoc candidates with a background in biochemistry (protein production
column2: purification and modification) or microbial engineering (yeasts
column3: gram-positive bacteria) in the direction of biotechnology.

column1: We are looking forward to your application including CV and publication list. Please send the documents as one single PDF file to wilfried.weber@cibss.uni-freiburg.de
Further information on our research group can be found at: https://www.bioss.uni-freiburg.de/groups/synthetic-biology/intro";CIBSS - Centre for Integrative Biological Signalling Studies;PhD

column1: PostDoc Biology
column3: Diagnostics (m/f/d);"The Helmholtz Institute for RNA-based Infection Research (HIRI) is offering a Postdoctoral position: ""Developing and commercializing CRISPR-based diagnostics"" (m/w/d) in the Research Group of RNA Synthetic Biology (RSYN) under the direction of Prof. Chase Beisel. The Helmholtz Institute for RNA-based Infection Research (HIRI) was established in May 2017 as a joint venture between the Helmholtz Centre for Infection Research (HZI) in Braunschweig and the Julius Maximilian University of Würzburg (JMU). The HIRI is the first research institution worldwide to exclusively address the role of RNA in infection processes. Based on novel findings
column4: innovative therapeutic approaches are developed in an integrated research approach and made clinically usable through the development of pharmaceutical forms of application. For more information
column5: please visit . The RSYN research group focuses on characterizing and harnessing CRISPR-Cas systems toward better understanding
column7: and treating human infections. The postdoctoral fellow will help lead efforts further developing a new CRISPR technology called LEOPARD for multiplexed RNA detection (Jiao et al.
column8: Science 2021). The project involves extending the existing platform to setups that can be implemented in different diagnostic settings. The project will then transition into a spin-off
column9: with the postdoc envisioned as a key member of the start-up team. PhD or equivalent in biology
column14: or a related field Highly motivated
column16: and independent Strong written and spoken English language communication skills Ability to work in and manage a technical team Entrepreneurial
column17: with a strong interest in technology advancement and launching a startup company Enjoy working in a fast changing
column18: dynamic working environment Desired (non-essential) background: Previous experience in CRISPR technologies
column20: and/or RNA design Familiar with diagnostic development and applications A unique opportunity to contribute to transitioning a novel technology from academic research to commercialization in a biotech startup An outstanding academic research environment
column21: and the opportunity to work with a novel CRISPR technology A semi-independent position with the opportunity and freedom to influence and organize your own work Varied activities in an international team with English as the primary language Compensation according to TVöD The opportunity to play a key role as a member of the startup team A family-friendly atmosphere with flexible working hours and part-time models
column22: a parent-child room and regular social activities Employment is through the Helmholtz Centre for Infection Research (Helmholtz-Zentrum für Infektionsforschung GmbH / HZI) in Braunschweig. The place of work is Würzburg. The position is suitable for part-time work. The HZI strives for professional equality between women and men. Therefore
column23: women are especially encouraged to apply. People with severe disabilities and equivalent professional qualifications who are suitable for the position are given preference. In order to protect your rights
column24: we ask you to provide us with a clearly recognizable reference to the existence of a degree of severe disability in your cover letter or resume. Starting date: As early as immediately. Funding ends 31 September
column26: with the intent of launching the start-up by this date. Follow-on funding through the Beisel lab is also being actively pursued. Salary: E 13 TVöD Bund Working time: 39 hours per week Place of work: Würzburg Probation period: 6 weeks/months Closing date: January 8

column1: CEO for Synthetic Biology / Biotechnology Startup;"SinFonia aims to produce novel bio-based fluorochemicals in a biological way that is significantly more sustainable than current chemical methods. SinFonia has developed a process to biomanufacture a diverse set of fluorinated molecules
column2: and has filed two patents with a third on the way. Fluorinated organic molecules have the potential to create highly specialised biomaterials or replace current organic synthesis of fluorinated pharmaceuticals

column1: The innovation potential of SinFonia is high
column2: as it sets the stage for a societally sustainable value chain for the production of novel
column3: bio-based fluoropolymers from renewable substrates. Materials containing the element fluorine are extremely important in our modern world
column7: Sinfonia strives to design cell factories for efficient synthesis of novel fluorinated products.

column2: Molecular Systems Biology / EMBO Molecular Medicine;"Your roleEMBO is seeking a highly motivated scientist with broad and international high-level research experience for the role of scientific editor at EMBO Molecular Medicine and / or Molecular Systems Biology. The editor has a diverse set of responsibilities towards ensuring that Molecular Systems Biology and EMBO Molecular Medicine
column3: as well as the other EMBO Press journals publish peer-reviewed material of the highest quality and broad general interest. The scientific editor reports to the deputy Head of Scientific Publications
column4: EMBO Press.The successful candidate will be responsible for selecting research papers as well as commissioning reviews and commentaries in a number of subject areas for publication. The candidate will be expected to form extensive contacts to the scientific community and engage in regular travel to conferences and research institutions. The scientific editor will be involved in all publication activities at the EMBO Press journals as well as other EMBO activities.Specific responsibilitiesIn the assigned subject areas
